title: Students showcase tech-driven, social innovation projects at NEEEV event in Delhi
description: New Delhi, Jan 28 (PTI) From Artificial Intelligence-based prototypes and low-cost technology solutions to ideas addressing everyday social challenges, students of Delhi government schools showcased a range of innovation-driven projects at the NEEEV zonal-level event. Education Minister Ashish Sood attended the programme as the chief guest at Sarvodaya Kanya Vidyalaya in Moti Bagh on Wednesday, […]
content:
He said India had witnessed a major startup boom over the past decade, with more than two lakh startups operating across the country today, and added that the NEEEV programme was preparing students to become part of this innovation-driven ecosystem.

title: Joseph Gordon-Levitt blasts ‘amoral’ AI companies as danger to kids
description: Joseph Gordon-Levitt has slammed “amoral” artificial intelligence (AI) companies that pose a danger to children in an address in the Capitol in Utah. On Tuesday (27 January), the Inception actor attended a committee to support a bill that pushes for child protection and transparency from such businesses. Mr Gordon-Levitt told lawmakers that as a father, he is scared for his children. “I’m worried about them growing up in a future that’s dominated by these amoral AI businesses that have proven time and time again that they are incapable of prioritising the well-being of kids.”
content:
Joseph Gordon-Levitt has slammed “amoral” artificial intelligence (AI) companies that pose a danger to children in an address in the Capitol in Utah.

title: Amazon to cut 16,000 jobs worldwide
description: Amazon is focusing spending on artificial intelligence. Read more at straitstimes.com.
content:
NEW YORK - US online retail and cloud computing giant Amazon said on Jan 28 that it would be cutting 16,000 jobs worldwide as part of a restructuring, as it focuses spending on artificial intelligence.

description: SEAGATE Technology forecast third-quarter revenue and profit above Wall Street expectations on Tuesday, benefiting from strong demand for its data storage devices as enterprises scale up their use of artificial intelligence (AI).

title: China gives green light to importing first batch of Nvidia's H200 AI chips
description: CHINA has approved its first batch of Nvidia’s H200 artificial intelligence (AI) chips for import, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters, marking a shift in position as China seeks to balance its AI needs against spurring domestic development.

title: Signing of Deals on Uranium, Energy, Minerals & AI on Cards During Canada PM Carney's Visit To India in March: Sources
description: The Canadian Prime Minister's visit is likely to see the signing of deals on uranium, energy, minerals, and Artificial Intelligence. Sources in the Ministry of External Affairs said there would be a key focus on trade during PM Carney's visit to India.
content:
New Delhi: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is set to visit India in the first week of March.
